alert.note: Alert for Howell (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 1:06PM CDT until August 09 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Howell. In southwest Missouri, Ozark and Taney. * WHEN...Until 245 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1257 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the advisory area. Flooding of low lying areas and areas with poor drainage is expected. - This includes the following low water crossings... Little North Fork at Haskins Ford Road, Lick Creek at County Road 528, Turkey Creek at County Road 830, Spring Creek at County Road 349, Pond Fork at County Road 883, Possum Walk Creek at Highway T and Little North Fork River at County Road 916. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gainesville, Bakersfield, Theodosia, Pontiac, Sundown, Willhoit, Hardenville, Brixey, Isabella, Zanoni, Noble, Tecumseh, Thornfield, Sycamore, Udall, Long Run, Caulfield, Rueter, Bull Shoals Lake and Norfork Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
